Description: PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT TO PROVIDE UNDERGRADUATE/GRADUATE RESEARCHERS, INDIVIDUALS WITH BACHELORS OR MASTER'S DEGREES, POST-DOCTORAL ASSOCIATES, SENIOR RESEARCH FELLOWS AND ACADEMIC AFFILIATES WITH FELLOWSHIP OPPORTUNITIES AND FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO OBTAIN LABORATORY EXPERIENCES AND AID IN DEVELOPING COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH RELATIONSHIPS WITH NIST STAFF WITHIN THE NIST BOULDER LABORATORY.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: PREP SEEKS TO ENCOURAGE THE GROWTH AND PROGRESS OF SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING IN THE UNITED STATES, INCLUDING THE ENCOURAGEMENT OF WOMEN AND MINORITY RESEARCHERS SEEKING TO FURTHER THEIR PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AND TO NURTURE RESEARCHERS AND POST-DOCTORAL ASSOCIATES CONSIDERED TO BE POTENTIAL FUTURE NIST EMPLOYEES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE OBJECTIVES OF THE PREP PROGRAM ARE TO: 1) ENCOURAGE THE GROWTH AND PROGRESS OF SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING IN THE UNITED STATES BY PROVIDING RESEARCH OPPORTUNITIES FOR PREP RESEARCHERS WITH NIST SCIENTISTS AND ENGINEERS AND EXPOSING THEM TO CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT (R&D); 2) PROMOTE THE PURSUIT OF DEGREES OR PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AS APPLICABLE, FOR PREP RESEARCHERS; AND 3) PROMOTE DIVERSITY AND EQUITY IN STEM.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: NIST AND NIST RESEARCHERS, AND UNDERGRADUATE/GRADUATE RESEARCHERS, INDIVIDUALS WITH BACHELORS OR MASTER'S DEGREES, POST-DOCTORAL ASSOCIATES, SENIOR RESEARCH FELLOWS AND ACADEMIC AFFILIATES, EMPLOYED BY OR AFFILIATED WITH THE UNIVERSITIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO SUPPORT THE NATIONAL INITIATIVE FOR CYBERSECURITY EDUCATION (NICE), INCLUDING OUTREACH EFFORTS TO THE CYBERSECURITY EDUCATION, TRAINING, AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT COMMUNITY. THIS OUTREACH WILL INCLUDE PLANNING AND MANAGING THE NICE ANNUAL CONFERENCE AND EXPO.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: AN ANNUAL EVENT WILL BE HELD TO BRING TOGETHER THOUGHT LEADERS FROM ACADEMIA, INDUSTRY, GOVERNMENT, AND NON-PROFITS TO HELP ADDRESS THE NATIONS CYBERSECURITY EDUCATION, TRAINING, AND WORKFORCE NEEDS. THIS INCLUDES THE FULL RANGE OF PRE-CONFERENCE ACTIVITIES FROM DETERMINING TRACKS, CONTENT, AND SPEAKERS AND ARRANGING THE VENUE TO MANAGING THE CONFERENCE LOGISTICS TO POST CONFERENCE WRAP UP ACTIVITIES. THE RECIPIENT MAY ALSO HOST OTHER COMMUNITY BUILDING EVENTS THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE AN OPPORTUNITY TO LEARN FROM PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SECTOR STAKEHOLDERS, A FORUM TO SHOWCASE BEST PRACTICES, AND  TO COLLECT INPUT TO SIGNAL NICE STRATEGIC DIRECTIONS AND PRIORITIES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PUBLIC WILL REMAIN INFORMED ON STRATEGIES, TOOLS, TECHNIQUES, AND PROGRAMS THAT THE BROADER GOVERNMENT, INDUSTRY, AND ACADEMIA ARE UTILIZING, HAVE CREATED, OR ARE CONSIDERING ENHANCING AND STRENGTHEN CYBERSECURITY EDUCATION, TRAINING, AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT FOR THE NATION. NIST WILL ALSO BENEFIT FROM NEW CONNECTIONS WHICH WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE THROUGH THE AWARDEES EXISTING PUBLIC/PRIVATE PARTNERSHIP MODEL. THE NICE STAKEHOLDER ENGAGEMENT PROGRAM OUTCOMES SUPPORT THE EXECUTION OF THE NICE STRATEGIC PLAN TO PREPARE, GROW, AND SUSTAIN A CYBERSECURITY WORKFORCE THAT SAFEGUARDS AND PROMOTES AMERICAS NATIONAL SECURITY AND ECONOMIC PROSPERITY. THE APPLICANT WILL CONTINUE TO GROW THEIR VISIBILITY IN THE CYBERSECURITY EDUCATION AND WORKFORCE FIELD. THEY WILL CONTINUE TO EXPAND THEIR STAKEHOLDER ENGAGEMENT AT THE NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL LEVEL.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT INTENDS TO PROVIDE A SUB-AWARD TO NEW AMERICA AS A LEADER IN CULTIVATING A NETWORK OF DIVERSE STAKEHOLDERS THAT DELIBERATELY SPANS REGIONAL, IDEOLOGICAL, SECTORAL, AND DEMOGRAPHIC GROUPS IN CYBERSECURITY.

PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT WILL EXTEND THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE INFORMATION SYSTEM (ERIS) FROM A TECHNOLOGY READINESS LEVEL (TRL) 5 TO A TRL OF 6-7 TO TEST THE SYSTEM IN A RELEVANT DEMONSTRATION TO PROVE IT IS EFFECTIVE IN OPERATIONS AND PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS, INTERFACE IT WITH EXISTING NETWORKS USED BY FIRST RESPONDERS TO MAKE IT INTEROPERABLE WITH COMPLEMENTARY CAPABILITIES. ERIS IS A MULTI-USERS AUGMENTED REALITY (AR) PLATFORM WHICH LEVERAGES REAL TIME DATA FROM EXTERNAL INTERFACED DATA SOURCES AND USER INPUT TO DISPLAY RELEVANT DATA USING ICONOGRAPHY TO ANNOTATE THE REAL WORLD TO DISTRIBUTE AND COMMUNICATE ALL KNOWN REAL TIME INFORMATION QUICKLY AND EFFICIENTLY ACROSS ALL DIVISIONS OF FIRST RESPONDERS IN THE FIELD.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THREE ACTIVITIES WILL BE PERFORMED:  1) TESTING: RESEARCHERS WILL DETERMINE WHAT IS THE MOST RELEVANT AND IMPACTFUL TYPE OF PROBLEM THAT ERIS CAN SOLVE (E.G. ACCOUNTABILITY), DEVELOP A TESTING SCENARIO, IDENTIFY GOOD TEST SITES, KPIS TO MEASURE, EXECUTE THE TEST AND FROM THE RESULTS DRIVE SUBSEQUENT DEVELOPMENT DIRECTIONS AND REPORT ON FINDINGS. 2) IMPLEMENTATION: RESEARCHERS WILL SUPPORT TESTING IN AN ACTUAL RELEVANT ENVIRONMENT AND ENABLE THE MINIMUM ROBUSTNESS, PERFORMANCE, AND SET OF CAPABILITIES NEEDED TO CONDUCT A TEST WITHOUT SOFTWARE ISSUES AND/OR HARDWARE FAILURES, AS WELL TO IMPROVE OUR UI, CAPABILITIES AND PERFORMANCE FROM WHAT WE LEARN FROM TESTING. 3) INTERFACING/PUBLISHING: RESEARCHERS WILL INTERFACE THE SYSTEM WITH EXISTING NETWORKS OR DISTRIBUTION CHANNELS TO PROVIDE COMPLEMENTARY CAPABILITIES AND CONNECTION TO EXISTING NETWORKS, AND MAKE THE APPLICATION AVAILABLE BY PUBLISHING IT TO APPLICATION STORES USED BY THE COMMUNITY.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT EXPECTS TO RESULT IN ESSENTIAL SOFTWARE AND HARDWARE DEVELOPMENTS THAT WILL ALLOW ERIS TO TEST IN ACTUAL (I.E. NON TESTING) RELEVANT ENVIRONMENTS, THAT WILL PROVIDE ADDITIONAL CRITICAL CAPABILITIES SUCH AS THE ABILITY TO TAG OR COMMUNICATE, AS WELL AS DEVELOPING AND EXECUTING TESTS THAT WILL PROVE THAT THOSE EFFORTS ARE MOVING THE NEEDLE FOR THE SAFETY COMMUNITY.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: FIRST RESPONDERS ARE THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE IS NO SUBRECIPIENT WITH THIS AWARD.

PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT WILL FURTHER TEST AND IMPROVE THE COMMUNICATION OF SITUATIONAL AWARENESS DATA THE SENSOR ROBOTS ARE UNIQUELY CAPABLE OF OBTAINING. BASED ON FIRST RESPONDER FEEDBACK FROM OUR PILOT PARTNERS, DIFFERENT COMMUNICATIONS TESTING AND DEMONSTRATION EFFORTS HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED  THAT WILL ADVANCE THE TECHNOLOGY READINESS LEVEL (TRL) OF THE SQUISHY ROBOTICS STATIONARY ROBOT.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FOUR COMMUNICATIONS TESTING AND DEMONSTRATION EFFORTS WILL BE PERFORMED WHICH WILL SIGNIFICANTLY SUPPORT THE FURTHER REFINEMENT OF THE SQUISHY ROBOTICS STATIONARY ROBOT EQUIPPED. THREE OF THE TESTING EFFORTS, (1) COMMUNICATIONS TERRAIN-OBSTRUCTION TESTING, (2) FIRE TRUCK INTEGRATION AND INTERFERENCE, AND (3) RF INTERFERENCE TESTING, ADDRESS THE TRANSMISSION OF DATA FROM DEPLOYED SENSORS TO FIRST RESPONDERS. THE FOURTH TESTING EFFORT, (4)USER INTERFACE AND FIRST RESPONDER-MACHINE TESTING FOCUSES ON IMPROVING THE PRESENTATION OR ANALYSIS OF DATA TO FIRST RESPONDERS TO IMPROVE THEIR COMPREHENSION AND UNDERSTANDING OF THE UI PRESENTATION OF EMERGENCY INFORMATION.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WILL AID SQUISHY ROBOTICS TO BETTER ENHANCE THE USER EXPERIENCE (UX) FOR OUR FIRST RESPONDERS. BY PROVIDING BETTER DATA VISUALIZATION AND A MORE INTUITIVE AND EASIER-TO-USE UI, FIRST RESPONDERS WILL BE MORE PREPARED TO RESPOND TO EVER-CHANGING SITUATIONS DURING EMERGENCY RESPONSE CALLS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: FIRST RESPONDERS ARE THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE IS NO SUBRECIPIENT WITH THIS AWARD.

PURPOSE: THE OVERALL GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO ADVANCE THE CURRENT BRUTE FORCE DEFAULT IDENTIFICATION?]AUTOMATED PREVENTION (BRDI-AP) ITERATION FROM A TECHNICAL READINESS LEVEL (TRL) 6 TO A TRL 7. TRL 6 IS DEFINED AS A DEMONSTRATION IN A RELEVANT ENVIRONMENT AND TRL 7 IS DEFINED AS A PROTOTYPE DEMONSTRATION IN THE FIELD.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THERE ARE THREE MAIN ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: 1) ENHANCE THE CURRENT PROTOTYPE TO A PRODUCTION]READY PROTOTYPE THAT IS ROBUST AND USER-FRIENDLY, INCORPORATES ADDITIONAL TELEMETRY EQUIPMENT USED BY PUBLIC SAFETY OPERATORS, AND ALLOWS MODULARITY FOR FUTURE UPDATES AND EQUIPMENT. 2) TEST AND ITERATE THE PROTOTYPE WITH ACTUAL USERS IN THE FIELD. 3) DOCUMENT OUR FINDINGS AND WIDELY DISTRIBUTE TECHNICAL OUTPUTS TO THE PUBLIC SAFETY COMMUNITY.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE OUTCOME OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE PUBLIC SAFETY WITH AN AUTOMATED SYSTEM TO CHECK FOR AND CORRECT VULNERABLE DEFAULT SETTINGS ON PUBLIC SAFETY UAS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PUBLIC SAFETY UNMANNED AERIAL SYSTEM (UAS) COMMUNITY IS THE INTENDED BENEFICIARY BECAUSE THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE PUBLIC SAFETY WITH AN AUTOMATED SYSTEM TO CHECK FOR AND CORRECT VULNERABLE DEFAULT SETTINGS ON PUBLIC SAFETY UAS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE IS NO SUBRECIPIENT WITH THIS AWARD.

PURPOSE: THE UNIVERSITY OF NORTH CAROLINA AT CHARLOTTE WILL DEVELOP FOUR STANDARDS-BASED EDUCATION MODULES THAT STRENGTHEN THE CONNECTION BETWEEN BUILDING INFORMATION MODELING (BIM), A DIGITAL REPRESENTATION OF PHYSICAL AND FUNCTIONAL CHARACTERISTICS OF A FACILITY, AND ITS FUNDAMENTAL TECHNOLOGY AND THE CONNECTIONS BETWEEN BIM AND DOCUMENTARY STANDARDS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE MODULES WILL INCLUDE BIM FOR BUILDING DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION, INFORMATION DELIVERY FROM CONSTRUCTION TO OPERATION, AND FOR INFORMATION EXCHANGES BETWEEN A BUILDING AND THIRD-PARTY SERVICE PROVIDERS FOR GRID INTERACTION AND ENERGY ANALYTICS. EACH EDUCATION MODULE WILL HAVE 2~5 SESSIONS WHILE EACH SESSION INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING COMPONENTS: 1) LEARNING OBJECTIVES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES, 2) LECTURE SLIDES, 3) VIDEO LECTURES, AND 4) HOMEWORK AND READING. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE MODULARIZED DESIGN WILL ENABLE THE EDUCATION MATERIALS TO BE EASILY ADOPTED OR BUILT UPON BY OTHER INTERESTED COURSE INSTRUCTORS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS WHO TAKE BIM-RELATED COURSES AND INSTRUCTORS WHO TEACH BIM-RELATED COURSES. SUBRECIPIENT: NONE

PURPOSE: TO DEVELOP AND FREELY DISSEMINATE STANDARDS EDUCATION MODULES FOR NANOMATERIALS ENGINEERING DESIGNED TO 1.) INTEGRATE NANOTECHNOLOGY-RELATED STANDARDS THROUGHOUT THE COURSE CURRICULUM TO DEVELOP STUDENT UNDERSTANDING OF STANDARDS PERTAINING TO VOCABULARY, CLASSIFICATIONS, AND CHARACTERIZATION AND PERFORMANCE TESTING OF NANOMATERIALS; 2.) PURPOSE: INFRATRAC IS DEVELOPING A NEW NEAR-INFRARED (NIR) SPECTROSCOPY-BASED TECHNIQUE TO IDENTIFY BIOMOLECULES AND ASSESS THEIR MEASURE OF QUALITY OR STATE OF DEGRADATION. NIR SPECTROSCOPY IS A NON-DESTRUCTIVE TESTING (NDT) TECHNIQUE AND IS INTENDED FOR USE IN QUALITY CONTROL DURING 3D DRUG-PRINTING PROCESSES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: INFRATRAC WILL COLLECT NIR SPECTRA OF KNOWN INGREDIENT SPECIMENS UTILIZED IN 3D DRUG-PRINTING. THE DEMONSTRATION TESTS WILL BE APPLIED TO KNOWN DRUGS INCLUDING ACETAMINOPHEN. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  INFRATRAC WILL CREATE A LIBRARY OF NIR SPECTROSCOPIC STANDARDS, TEST NIR MODELING AGAINST STANDARD PHARMACEUTICAL QUALITY MEASURES, AND DEFINE A DATA FRAMEWORK FOR IN-PROCESS NIR FOR 3D PRINTERS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE TECHNOLOGY WILL SUPPORT PATIENTS IN RECEIVING PERSONALIZED MEDICAL CARE WITH DRUGS CUSTOMIZED TO THEIR SIZE, METABOLISM, ALLERGIES, GENETICS, AND TASTE.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS IN THIS PROJECT.

PURPOSE: USENCRYPTION IS DEVELOPING AN APPROACH TO SIMULTANEOUSLY MAINTAIN DATA ENCRYPTION WHILE PERFORMING COMPUTATION ON THE ENCRYPTED DATA. THE PROCESS EMPLOYS A NEW BLOCK CIPHER AND A NEW PATENT-PENDING METHOD TO ENCRYPT BOTH THE DATA AND THE FUNCTIONS THAT OPERATE ON ENCRYPTED DATA. THE NEW CIPHER, INSPIRED BY QUANTUM CIRCUIT SCRAMBLERS, IS DESIGNED TO BE IMMUNE TO QUANTUM ATTACKS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: USENCRYPTION WILL (I) COMPARE THE NEW BLOCK CIPHER?S RANDOMNESS TO THAT OF THE APPROVED CRYPTOGRAPHIC ALGORITHM, AES; (II) CHECK ITS PERFORMANCE AGAINST STANDARD ATTACKS; AND (III) ENGAGE WITH NIST CRYPTOGRAPHY EXPERTS AND WITH THE BROADER CRYPTOGRAPHY COMMUNITY FOR TESTING, BENCHMARKING, AND VALIDATION. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  SUCCESS IN THESE ACTIVITIES WILL SERVE AS A CRITICAL BUILDING BLOCK TO A PIONEERING ENCRYPTED OPERATOR COMPUTING (EOC) METHOD BEING DEVELOPED OUTSIDE THIS PROPOSED PROJECT TO PROTECT DATA IN USE THROUGH ENCRYPTION.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE TECHNOLOGISTS DEVELOPING SECURE DATA PIPELINES FOR APPLICATIONS IN HEALTH CARE DATA OR IN FINANCIAL SERVICES DATA.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THIS AWARD DOESN'T INCLUDE ANY SUBAWARDS.

PURPOSE:  JULIA JEAN LLC AIMS TO CARRY FORWARD NIST-PATENTED TECHNOLOGY FOR A COLD SOURCE FIELD EMITTER BASED ON SILICON CARBIDE STRUCTURES. SWITCHING TO A COLD SOURCE-BASED SYSTEM ELIMINATES THE FILAMENT POWER SUPPLY AND SIMPLIFIES THE ELECTRON OPTICS REQUIRED TO FOCUS AND COLLIMATE ELECTRONS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS PROPOSAL WILL COMPARE THE VARIABLES IN LITHOGRAPHY STEPS TO IDENTIFY THE BEST PROCESS. VARIABLES TESTED WILL INCLUDE (A) WHETHER MASK-BASED LITHOGRAPHY CAN SUBSTITUTE FOR LOW-THROUGHPUT FOCUSED ION BEAM LITHOGRAPHY, PRODUCING SIMILARLY SHAPED MICROSCALE STRUCTURES; (B) WHETHER THE TECHNICAL ASPECTS OF THE REQUIRED LITHOGRAPHY STEPS ARE COMPATIBLE WITH NISTS ELECTROCHEMISTRY PROCEDURE; AND (C) WHETHER ELECTROCHEMISTRY SHOULD BE PERFORMED BEFORE OR AFTER LITHOGRAPHY, BEFORE VERSUS AFTER INTRODUCING POROSITY, AND THEN SCALE UP THE BEST PROCESS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  THE OUTCOMES FOR DIFFERENT PROCESS SEQUENCES WILL BE ANALYZED WITH AGAINST LOW-THROUGHPUT ION MILLING (FIB) TO DEFINE MICROSCALE STRUCTURES IN POROUS SILICON CARBIDE. THE RESULTING RECIPES WILL LEAD TO NEW INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: FIELD EMISSION ARRAYS ALLOW FOR ADVANCED, DIFFRACTION-BASED IDENTIFICATION OF MATERIALS, AS SEEN IN MEDICAL IMAGING (E.G., X-RAY FOR MEDICAL CT SCANS), AIRPORT BAGGAGE SCREENING, AND RELATED NATIONAL SECURITY APPLICATIONS (E.G, X-RAY, RADAR, AND MICROWAVE).SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: JULIA JEAN PLANS TO AWARD FUNDS FOR TECHNICAL AND BUSINESS ASSISTANCE (TABA) TO ASSIST WITH INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY ASSISTANCE.  THE COMPANY PROVIDING TABA HAS NOT YET BEEN IDENTIFIED.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF RATIOCINATIVE ENGINEERING SERVICES LLC?S (RATIOC) PROPOSAL IS TO DEVELOP A TESTBED THAT WILL LEAD TO MORE ACCESSIBLE AND ROBUST QUALITY CONTROL TESTING OF AIR FILTRATION AND VENTILATION SYSTEMS IN ACTUAL BUILT ENVIRONMENTS, THUS RESPONDING TO THE NEED FOR AIR FILTRATION TO REMOVE CORONAVIRUS OR OTHER AIRBORNE INFECTIOUS DISEASES FROM INDOOR AIR SPACES FOR PEOPLE.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES TO PERFORMED IN PHASES I AND II ARE AS FOLLOWS:PHASE I: TO TEST THE FEASIBILITY OF AN AIR FILTRATION TESTBED (INCLUDING A PARTICLE GENERATOR AND DETECTION SYSTEM) FOR EFFICACY AT REMOVING PROXY INFECTIOUS PARTICLES FROM AN AIR SPACE.PHASE II: TO DEVELOP REPEATABLE WORKING PROTOTYPE TESTBEDS FOR DETERMINING HOW EFFICIENTLYAN AIR FILTRATION SYSTEM IS CAPABLE OF CLEARING THE PROXY INFECTIOUS PARTICLES FROM THE AIR VOLUME, AS WELL AS DETERMINING INTER-ROOM PARTICLE.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PRODUCT BEING PROPOSED BY RATIOC WILL RESULT IN A SYSTEM THAT CAN MEASURE THE DYNAMIC EFFECTIVENESS OF AN AIR FILTRATION SYSTEM BY SENSING PROXY INFECTIOUS DISEASE PARTICLES AT MULTIPLE SITES IN A BUILT AIRSPACE AND RETAIN CONSISTENCY WITH STANDARDS FOR INDOOR AIR QUALITY. BY GENERATING MULTIPLE (QUADRATURE), UNIQUE FLUORESCENT PARTICLES INSTEAD OF RELYING ON AMBIENT PARTICLES, LOWER COST INSTRUMENTATION CAN BE UTILIZED, BETTER DATA CAN BE COLLECTED, AND THE TESTING CAN BE RUN MORE QUICKLY.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE AIR FILTRATION DEVELOPMENT COMPANIES, SCHOOLS, PUBLIC BUILDINGS, WORKSPACES, AND OTHER INDOOR AREAS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: IN PHASE I, SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES WILL CONSIST OF THE FOLLOWING:-	PRODUCTION OF PROTOTYPE PRINTED CIRCUIT BOARDS, TO INTERFACE WITH LEDS AND DIGITIZEFLUORESCENCE SIGNALS WILL BE PROVIDED BY ROYAL CIRCUIT SOLUTIONS (HOLLISTER, CALIFORNIA).-	MACHINING OF CUSTOM PARTS FOR BOTH THE PARTICLE GENERATOR AND THE FLUORESCENT SENSORSINCLUDING HOUSINGS AND PRECISION OPTICAL PARTS ERIC LAYTON - CONSULTANT.-	COMPARISONS TO EXISTING INDUSTRY STANDARDS FOR PARTICLE MEASUREMENT WILL BE PROVIDED BY PARTICLE MEASUREMENT SYSTEMS (BOULDER, COLORADO).-	TECHNICAL INPUT FOR FLUORESCENCE DESIGN PROVIDED BY DR. CARSON TEALE, CONSULTANTPHASE II SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES WILL CONSIST OF THE FOLLOWING:-	MANUFACTURING QUANTITY PRODUCTION OF PRINTED CIRCUIT BOARDS, FOR DESIGN REPRODUCIBILITY,VERIFICATION AND VALIDATION TO BE PROVIDED BY ROYAL CIRCUIT SOLUTIONS (HOLLISTER, CALIFORNIA).-	MACHINING AND INJECTION MOLDING OF CUSTOM PARTS FOR BOTH THE PARTICLE GENERATOR AND THEFLUORESCENT SENSORS (HOUSINGS, PRECISION OPTICAL PARTS) TO BE PROVIDED BY ERIC LAYTON.-	COMPARISONS TO EXISTING INDUSTRY STANDARDS FOR PARTICLE MEASUREMENT TO BE PROVIDED BY PARTICLE MEASUREMENT SYSTEMS (BOULDER, COLORADO).-	FCC EMC PRE-COMPLIANCE TESTING ? PLANNING FOR COMMERCIALIZATION TO BE PROVIDED BY EMI TEST LAB (LONGMONT, COLORADO).-	TECHNICAL INPUT FOR THE OPTICAL SYSTEM WILL BE PROVIDED BY DR. CARSON TEALE, CONSULTANT.

PERFORM EFFICACY TESTING ON COMPLETE PPE ITEMS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  VURONYX TECHNOLOGIES PLANS TO DEVELOP A POWDER BASED FORMULATION THAT WILL GENERATE A LIQUID SOLUTION THAT CAN DISINFECT A WIDE RANGE OF MICROBES. MATERIALS CAN BE DESIGNED AND DISCOVERED TO IMPROVE THE ENERGY EFFICIENCY OF THE ELECTRONICS, MAKE LIGHTER WEIGHT AUTOMOBILES (WHICH ARE MORE FUEL EFFICIENT), FASTER COMPUTER CHIPS, QUANTUM DEVICES WITH NOVEL PROPERTIES, MORE RESILIENT ARMOR, IMPACT PROTECTION, ETC. THE LIST IS NEARLY ENDLESS, AND THESE TECHNIQUES ARE POISED TO USHER IN A REVOLUTION IN MATERIALS INNOVATION. IN PRIOR YEARS THERE HAS BEEN SIGNIFICANT INDUSTRIAL PARTICIPATION, AND WE EXPECT THIS YEAR WILL BE NO DIFFERENT.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE INDUSTRY, ACADEMIC, AND NATIONAL LAB SCIENTISTS WHO WILL LEARN DATA SCIENCE AND MACHINE LEARNING SKILLS. THROUGH THIS GREATER KNOWLEDGE, THE GENERAL PUBLIC WILL BENEFIT THROUGH A GREATER NUMBER OF SCIENTISTS WITH THE SKILLS TO ACCELERATE THE DEVELOPMENT OF TECHNOLOGY-RELEVANT MATERIALS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO BUILD, DEMONSTRATE, AND EVALUATE IN CLASSROOM SETTINGS OF HAZVR, A HAZMAT TRAINING PROJECT.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS PROJECT WILL BUILD, DEMONSTRATE, AND EVALUATE IN CLASSROOM SETTINGS OF HAZVR. HAZVR WILL BE A HAZMAT AIR-MONITORING TRAINING MODULE THAT REINFORCES CONCEPTS TAUGHT IN CLASSROOMS USING VIRTUAL REALITY (VR)1 AIR MONITOR INSTRUMENTS WITHIN THE CONTEXT OF LOW-FREQUENCY HIGH-RISK HAZMAT INCIDENTS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PROJECT EXPECTS TO BRING HAZVR TO A TECHNOLOGY READINESS LEVEL (TRL) 7 BY: 1) BUILDING THE HAZVR TRAINING MODULE IN COLLABORATION WITH HAZMAT SPECIALISTS. (2) VALIDATE THE TRAINING MODULE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: HAZMAT TRAINEES ARE THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES AS THEY WILL BE ABLE TO PRACTICE, LEARN, DISCUSS, AND REFLECT UPON WORKING IN THE FULL CONTEXT OF HIGH-RISK LOW-FREQUENCY SITUATIONS SO THAT THEY CAN SAFELY OBTAIN MORE EXPERIENTIAL TRAINING OF INCIDENTS, WHICH IS NOT CURRENTLY POSSIBLE WITHOUT WORKING IN ACTUAL HAZARDOUS ENVIRONMENTS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS FOR THIS PROJECT.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO FACILITATE THE INCREASED USE OF CALPHAD-BASED MATERIALS DESIGN TOOLS IN SUPPORT OF THE MATERIALS DESIGN GENOME INITIATIVE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: AS A PART OF THE 50TH CALPHAD ANNUAL CONFERENCE THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES WILL HELP FACILITATE THE USE OF CALPHAD-BASED TOOLS AND METHODOLOGIES TO SUPPORT ADVANCE MANUFACTURING.   THE CONFERENCE WILL SUPPORT THE DISCUSSIONS OF ADVANCED THERMODYNAMIC MODELING FOR MULTICOMPONENT ALLOYS, POLYMERS, AND CERAMICS; INNOVATIONS IN MATERIALS SCIENCE EDUCATION; FACILITATE INTERACTIONS BETWEEN YOUNG RESEARCHERS AND INDUSTRY PROFESSIONALS; AND PROMOTE THE DISCUSSION OF CRITICAL CHALLENGES IN ACCELERATING ADVANCE MANUFACTURING.  IN ADDITION TO THE CONFERENCE, WORKSHOPS WILL BE HELD TO ADVANCE THE TRAINING OF BOTH STUDENTS AND PROFESSIONALS ON VARIETY DEVELOPING CALPHAD-BASED TOOLS FOR BOTH MATERIALS DESIGN AND ACCELERATED DATABASE DEVELOPMENT.  EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE CONFERENCE AND WORKSHOPS ON DEVELOPING AND DEPLOYING CALPHAD METHODS AND TOOLS WILL ADVANCE THE USE BY RESEARCHERS AND INDUSTRY.   THE WORKSHOP AND CONFERENCE SUMMARIES WILL BE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC AT THE CALPHAD.ORG SITE.   THE WORKSHOP PARTICIPANTS WILL HAVE ACCESS TO THE PRESENTATIONS AND DEMONSTRATION TOOLS.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE RESEARCHERS INTERESTED IN THE FURTHER DEVELOPMENT OF CALPHAD METHODS AND TOOLS AND INDUSTRY PARTICIPANTS INTERESTED IN DEVELOPING AND OPTIMIZING NEW MATERIALS AND PROCESSING METHODS FOR ADVANCED MANUFACTURING.  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT THE INTERNATIONAL HYDROGEN CONFERENCE IN PARK CITY, UTAH, IN SEPTEMBER2023.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE INTERNATIONAL HYDROGEN CONFERENCE WILL BE HELD IN PARK CITY, UTAH, DURING SEPTEMBER 17-20, 2023. EXPERTS INHYDROGEN EMBRITTLEMENT FROM INDUSTRY AND ACADEMIA, INCLUDING THOSE AT NIST, WILL ATTEND TO PRESENT AND DISCUSSSTATE-OF-THE-ART RESEARCH IN THE FIELD. ALSO ATTENDING WILL BE A SIGNIFICANT NUMBER OF GRADUATE STUDENTS, REPRESENTINGTHE NEXT GENERATION IN THE FIELD. SUPPORT FROM THE GRANT WILL HELP LOWER CONFERENCE REGISTRATION FEES, ENCOURAGINGMORE STUDENT PARTICIPATION.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:A SUCCESSFULLY CONDUCTED CONFERENCE WILL ALLOW DISSEMINATION OF STATE-OF-THE-ART RESEARCH THROUGH INTERACTIONS AT THECONFERENCE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL ALLOW ENGINEERING CONFERENCES INTERNATIONAL (ECI) TO APPLY THEIR EXPERTISE IN CONFERENCEORGANIZATION. THE SUPPORT WILL ALLOW ECI TO LOWER CONFERENCE ATTENDANCE FEES ENCOURAGING ATTENDANCE FROM STUDENTSAND RESEARCHERS FROM A RANGE OF ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS.THE TECHNOLOGIES THAT ARE DEVELOPED THROUGH THIS PROJECT COULD BE APPLIED TO THE LARGE ARRAY OF HYDROGEN FUELTECHNOLOGIES WHICH ARE BEING DEVELOPED THROUGH ENERGY AND CHEMICAL INDUSTRIES IN THE US AND WORLD-WIDE, ANDBENEFIT THE GENERAL PUBLIC. AS DRIVE FOR A CARBON-NEUTRAL ENERGY ECONOMY TAKES OFF, A LARGE FOCUS IS ON HYDROGEN ASAN ALTERNATIVE FUEL. THE RESEARCH PRESENTED AT THIS EVENT WILL PROVIDE CRITICAL INFORMATION FOR DEVELOPING MATERIALSAND TECHNOLOGIES THAT ARE COMPATIBLE WITH THIS NEW ENERGY ECONOMY. THIS ENABLES HYDROGEN TO BE USED AS A LOWCARBONENERGY SOURCE AND LOWERS THE COST TO END-USERS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO HELP DEFER THE REGISTRATION, TRAVEL EXPENSES AND LOCAL ACCOMMODATION COSTS FOR EIGHT OF THE INVITED PLENARY AND SEMI-PLENARY SPEAKERS TO ATTEND AND PRESENT THEIR WORK AT THE 10TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON MULTISCALE MATERIALS MODELING CONFERENCE (MMM 10), TO BE HELD IN BALTIMORE, MARYLAND, USA ON OCTOBER 2-7,2022.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDING WILL BE PROVIDED TO DEFER THE ATTENDANCE COSTS FOR EIGHT OF THE INVITED PLENARY AND SEMI-PLENARY SPEAKERS FOR THE 10TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON MULTISCALE MATERIALS MODELING CONFERENCE (MMM 10), TO BE HELD IN BALTIMORE, MARYLAND, USA ON OCTOBER 2-7,2022.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS CONFERENCE IS EXPECTED TO GATHER MORE THAN 750 PARTICIPANTS FROM AROUND THE WORLD WITH A MAIN SCOPE ON ?ENABLING MATERIALS PREDICTION, DESIGN, AND MANUFACTURING THROUGH RIGOROUS SCALE BRIDGING AND MATERIALS INFORMATICS?. THIS CONFERENCE WILL BRING TOGETHER RESEARCHERS FROM ACADEMIA, NATIONAL LABORATORIES, AND INDUSTRY FROM ACROSS THE GLOBE WITH INTERDISCIPLINARY RESEARCH BACKGROUNDS IN MATERIALS SCIENCE, MATHEMATICS,PHYSICS, BIOLOGY, AND COMPUTER SCIENCE. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PARTICIPATING RESEARCHERS FROM ACADEMIA, NATIONAL LABORATORIES, AND INDUSTRY WILL BENEFIT FROM DIRECT INTERACTION AND INFORMATION SHARING WITH THEIR PEERS.  THIS IS THUS AN IDEAL FORUM FOR JUNIOR SCIENTISTS TO BE EXPOSED TO THE STATE-OF-THE-ART IN MMM, AS WELL AS TO SHOWCASE THEIR OWN RESEARCH TO WORLD RENOWNED EXPERTS AND GAIN INSTANT RECOGNITION.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PLASTICS ENGINEERING DEPARTMENT IN THE UNIVERSITY OF MASSACHUSETTS AT LOWELL WILL DEVELOP A SERIES OF CASE STUDY MODULES FOR THEIR UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS THAT ARE THEN TRANSFERRED INTO PARALLEL CURRICULUM IN THE MECHANICAL ENGINEERING, CHEMICAL ENGINEERING AND CHEMISTRY WITH THE INTENTION TO TEST TRANSFERABILITY TO RELATED FIELDS AND POTENTIAL FOR EXPANSION TO OTHERS, SUCH AS MATERIALS SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE PROPOSAL OUTLINES SIX CASE STUDIES TO BE DEVELOPED AND INCORPORATED INTO SOME SUBSET OF ELEVEN LISTED COURSES IN THE PLASTICS ENGINEERING BACHELORS DEGREE PROGRAM AND/OR A GRADUATE LEVEL COURSE.  THERE IS A STRONG LEARNING DEVELOPMENT INFRASTRUCTURE AND METHOD DEVELOPMENT PLAN IN THE PROPOSAL TO USE THE FIRST TWO YEARS TO REFINE THESE STUDIES WITH THE INTENTION OF EXPANDING THEIR USE INTO OTHER DEPARTMENTS IN YEAR 3.  EACH CASE HAS A PROBLEM STATEMENT, SAMPLE DATA AND ACTIVITY EXERCISES, DISCUSSION PROMPTS, AND UNIQUE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES.  THE SIX EXAMPLES INCLUDE DESIGN OF MECHANICAL PROCESSING FOR RECYCLED RESINS, SIX SIGMA OPTIMIZATION OF BLOW MOLDED RECYCLED BLENDS, SYSTEMS ANALYSIS FOR COMMUNITY DECISION SUPPORT, POTENTIAL BIODEGRADABLE REPLACEMENTS FOR CURRENT POLYMERS, UV EXPOSURE AND REPEATED THERMAL CYCLING EFFECTS ON FILM PROPERTIES, AND MOLD DESIGN AND PROCESSING FOR BIO-BASED AND RECYCLED PLASTICS.  FUTURE MODULES ARE ANTICIPATED IN PLASTICS HEALTH AND SAFETY AND END-OF-LIFE OPTIONS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: STUDENTS WILL GAIN AN AWARENESS OF CHALLENGES AND OPPORTUNITIES IN PRODUCT DESIGN, MATERIALS PROPERTIES, PROCESSING AND RECYCLING OF PLASTICS.  THEY WILL ALSO UNDERSTAND THE CRITICAL ROLE OF CHARACTERIZATION IN CONTROLLING AND IMPROVING THE FULL LIFECYCLE OF PLASTICS, AS WELL AS THE TRADEOFFS ASSOCIATED WITH COMPLEX DECISION MAKING FOR MORE SUSTAINABLE PLASTICS USES. ALL CASE STUDY MATERIALS WILL BE PLACES ON A UMASS LOWELL WEBSITE AND MADE FREE TO DOWNLOAD.  A SERIES OF WEBINARS IS ALSO PLANNED AS WELL AS POTENTIAL ADAPTATION TO CONTINUING EDUCATION CONTENT FOR INDUSTRY PROFESSIONALS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE EXPANDED AND MODERNIZED CURRICULUM.  THE BROADER ENGINEERING AND SCIENCE COMMUNITY WILL BENEFIT FROM PUBLIC RESOURCES PRODUCED, AND THE HIGH LEVEL OF EDUCATIONAL EXPERTISE BROUGH TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE CONTENT.  THERE IS LONG TERM POTENTIAL FOR INDUSTRY PROFESSIONALS TO BENEFIT FROM CONTINUOUS LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES, AND BUSINESSES TO BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED TRAINING OF FUTURE HIRES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT PLANS TO SUBAWARD $25,000 TO FUND ASSISTANCE WITH REFINING THE USE CASE MODULES FROM THE EDUCATION AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT TEAM OF THE REMADE MANUFACTURING INSTITUTE.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO CREATE SEVEN TRANSPORTABLE CURRICULUM MODULES WHICH CAN BE USED TO SUPPORT A NEW CERTIFICATE OR DEGREE IN SUSTAINABLE MACROMOLECULAR MATERIALS AND MANUFACTURING.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE MODULES SPAN RELEVANT DISCIPLINES OF ECONOMICS AND FINANCE, SYSTEMS THINKING, MATERIALS DESIGN AND MANUFACTURING FOR PERFORMANCE AND RECOVERY, AND IMPROVING RECOVERED MATERIAL QUALITY.  THE MODULES WILL BE USED TO CONSTRUCT A TWO SEMESTER, LABORATORY-BASED CURRICULUM, AND WILL BE INTEGRATED INTO DEGREE PROGRAMS AT BOTH THE PRIMARY INSTITUTION, ARIZONA STATE UNIVERSITY, AND THEIR SUBAWARD PARTNER, VIRGINIA TECH, PARTNER INSTITUTION UNIVERSITY OF ARIZONA, AND LOCAL COMMUNITY COLLEGES THROUGH THE ASU BROADENING PARTICIPATION CENTER.  THERE ARE ALSO PLANS FOR DISSEMINATION THROUGH ACS, NSF AND NIST, THOUGH THOSE EVENTS AND ACTIVITIES ARE CASUALLY REFERENCED, AND DID NOT INCLUDE SUBSTANTIAL DETAIL.  IT IS NOT CLEAR WHO THE PARTNERS FOR A NIST WORKSHOP MIGHT BE. THERE IS ALSO PROMISING ENGAGEMENT PLANNED WITH ARIZONA PUBLIC WORKS AND ARIZONA FORWARD, BOTH ORGANIZATIONS DEEPLY ENGAGED IN PUBLIC ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND EDUCATION AND RECYCLING AND SUSTAINABILITY.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE MODULAR NATURE OF THE COURSE CONTENT IS INTENDED TO BE TRANSFERABLE TO DIVERSE LEARNING ENVIRONMENTS AND AREAS OF STUDY, WHICH WILL BROADEN ACCESS TO CONTEXTUALIZED LEARNING ON POLYMER SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING, INCLUDING CRITICAL COMPUTATIONAL AND ENGINEERING ORIENTED FINANCE FACTORS RELEVANT TO INNOVATION TO SOLVE KEY CHALLENGES.  THE PROPOSING TEAM ALSO HAS EXPERIENCE CONVERTING EDUCATIONAL CONTENT INTO MULTIPLE SETTINGS TO PROMOTE A WIDE RANGE OF DISSEMINATION TO DIVERSE STAKEHOLDER GROUPS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: STUDENTS SEEKING ASSOCIATES, UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE DEGREES FROM MULTIPLE INSTITUTIONS WILL BENEFIT FROM ACCESS TO THE MODULES.  THE INTRODUCTION OF THESE CONCEPTS INTO BROADER SUSTAINABILITY EDUCATION IN SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING WILL PROVIDE NECESSARY TRAINING TO FUTURE EMPLOYEES, PARTICULARLY IN THE SOUTHWESTERN REGION, AND OTHERS AS THE PROGRAM IS IMPLEMENTED BY PARTNER INSTITUTIONS.  THERE WILL ALSO BE TRANSITION TO CONTINUING EDUCATION CONTENT FOR BUSINESSES TO SUPPORT FURTHER DEVELOPMENT OF THEIR WORKFORCES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT PLANS TO SUBAWARD FUNDS TO FACULTY AT ANOTHER UNIVERSITY TO LEND THE TECHNOECONOMIC, LCA, MFA AND BACK CASTING EXPERTISE TO THIS RESEARCH PROJECT AND LEAD THOSE ASPECTS OF THE MODULE DEVELOPMENT.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO MAKE IMPROVEMENTS TO UPDATE THE PLASTICS ENGINEERING TECHNOLOGY DEGREE PROGRAM AT PITTSBURG STATE UNIVERSITY WITH BOTH LECTURE-BASED AND HANDS-ON LABORATORY LEARNING MODULES FOCUSED ON PLASTICS CIRCULARITY IN THE MATERIALS, DESIGN AND PROCESSING PHASES OF PRODUCTION.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: A HIGHLY QUALIFIED TEAM OF FACULTY IN THE EXISTING PROGRAM WILL CREATE LEARNING CONTENT ON CIRCULARITY ACROSS MULTIPLE COURSES IN THEIR DEGREE PROGRAM INCLUDING GENERAL PLASTICS AND GENERAL PLASTICS LABORATORY, PLASTICS PROCESSING I AND II, PLASTICS TESTING TECHNOLOGY, THERMOPLASTIC RESINS AND THERMOPLASTIC RESINS LABORATORY, PART AND MOLD DESIGN, AND SENIOR PROJECT I AND II.  THE TEAM WILL ALSO CREATE A NEW SENIOR COURSE ON ADDITIVES, FORMULATION AND COMPOUNDING WHICH WILL INCLUDE ELEMENTS OF REGRINDING AND REPROCESSING.  CONTENT WILL INCLUDE CONCEPTS LIKE ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENT, POTENTIAL FOR REUSE OF OCEAN PLASTICS DEBRIS, AND BROADER SOCIETAL CONCEPTS SUCH AS LABELING, ACCESS TO RECYCLING FACILITIES AND DEFINITIONS OF PACKAGING TYPES, AND OTHER CLASSIFICATIONS OFTEN POORLY UNDERSTOOD BY THE GENERAL PUBLIC AND FIELD TRIPS TO LOCAL BUSINESSES AND MUNICIPAL FACILITIES RELEVANT TO MATERIALS RECOVERY, AS WELL AS OPPORTUNITIES TO TRAVEL TO NATIONAL CONFERENCES.  THIS WORK WILL NECESSARILY REQUIRE SOME REFRESHING OF UNDERGRADUATE TEACHING LABORATORY FACILITIES AND SOME SOFTWARE UPDATES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE CONCEPTS OF CIRCULARITY, MATERIALS RECOVERY AND THE FULL SYSTEM/LIFE-CYCLE APPROACH WILL BE INTEGRATED INTO THE FULL DEGREE PROGRAM AT THE UNIVERSITY, MAKING IT AN ESSENTIAL ELEMENT OF ANY DEGREE. THERE ARE CLEAR METRICS IDENTIFIED FOR EACH COURSE BASED ON PARTICIPATION RATES AND COMPREHENSION ASSESSMENT.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE DEGREE PROGRAM?S GRADUATES ENJOY A 100% PLACEMENT IN INDUSTRY UPON GRADUATION.  THIS MEANS A DIRECT BENEFIT TO THE STUDENTS, AND THEIR FUTURE EMPLOYERS.  THE PROGRAM MAY ALSO HELP EXPAND THE APPEAL OF THE DEGREE TO NON-TRADITIONAL STUDENTS INTERESTED IN THIS EMERGING CHALLENGE IN THE FIELD.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CREATE A MULTIDISCIPLINARY MINOR IN PLASTICS CIRCULARITY THAT WILL BE AVAILABLE TO ANYONE ACQUIRING MAJOR DEGREES IN CHEMISTRY, CHEMICAL ENGINEERING, ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING, ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE OR BUSINESS/ENTREPRENEURSHIP. IN ADDITION, THE PROJECT WILL CREATE A SUMMER SCHOOL TARGETING COMMUNITY COLLEGE AND PRIMARILY UNDERGRADUATE SERVING INSTITUTIONS (PUIS).ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE PROPOSING TEAM WILL ADD TWO NEW COURSES (POLYMER CHEMISTRY AND POLYMER MEASUREMENT AND SUSTAINABILITY LABORATORY).  BOTH WOULD BE REQUIRED COURSED COMBINED WITH PREREQUISITES N CHEMISTRY AND MATH, AS WELL AS OTHER COURSE WORK IN SOME COMBINATION OF ENVIRONMENTAL ENGINEERING, GENERAL ENGINEERING, BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION AND MANAGEMENT AND ORGANIZATION DEPARTMENTS AND CHEMICAL ENGINEERING. THE POLYMER LABORATORY CLASSROOM IN PARTICULAR IS IN NEED OF SUPPLEMENTAL EQUIPMENT FOR INSTRUCTION PURPOSES.  THEY WILL ALSO PRODUCE A ?MICRO-SEMINAR? FOR INCOMIONG FRESHMENT TO SHOWCASE THE IMPORTANCE AND BREADTH OF THIS NEW MINOR DEGREE IN THE FORM OF TWO 90 MINUTE OVERVIEW SEMINARS.  THE SEMINARS WILL INCLUDE PERSPECTIVES FROM EXPERTS IN MANUFACTURING AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP.  THE TEAM IS ALSO ADDING AN INNOVATIVE WEEK-LONG SUMMER WORKSHOP DESIGNED TO ENGAGE LOCAL COMMUNITY COLLEGE AND PUI STUDENTS IN THE GREATER LOS ANGELES REGION (E.G. CERRITOS COLLEGE, LOS ANGELES PIERCE COLLEGE, CAL POLY POMONA AND LOCAL CALSTATE CAMPUSES).  THE WORKSHOP WILL INCLUDE A COMBINATION OF LECTURE, FIELD TRIP (CATALINA ISLAND BEACH CLEANUP AND BUSINESS TOURS) AND LABORATORY EXPERIENCES.  THERE IS OUTREACH PLANNED WITH THE BOY SCOUTS OF AMERICA (ON CATALINA ISLAND) AS WELL AS THROUGH STANDING UP A STUDENT-RUN ORGANIZATION ON PLASTICS SUSTAINABILITY.  EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE CHEMISTRY DEPARTMENT HAS A RECENTLY FUNDED PROGRAM WITH THE AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF UNIVERSITIES THROUGH WHICH IT WILL BE ABLE TO DISSEMINATE RESULTS AND FACILITATE TRANSFER TO OTHER INSTITUTIONS. THEY ALSO PLAN TO PUBLISH OPEN SOURCE COURSE MATERIALS, AND WORK WITH INDUSTRY TO SET UP INTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITIES (KEURIG-DR. PEDPPER AND VERDECO ARE ALREADY ONBOARD) AND RECRUITING PIPELINES. THEY ARE ANTICIPATING 10-20 MINORS OUT OF THE APPROXIMATELY 75 CANDIDATES IN ANY GIVEN YEAR IN THE CHEMISTRY PIPELINE ALONE.  THEY EXPECT THIS EXPERIENCE TO HELP WITH GRADUATE AND PROFESSIONAL SCHOOL PLACEMENT AND AN INCREASE IN DIRECT TRANSITION TO INDUSTRY POSITIONS FOR STUDENTS COMPLETING THE MINOR. THEY ALSO HOPE TO INCREASE TRANSITIONS FROM COMMUNITY COLLEGE PARTNERS TO 4-YEAR DEGREE PROGRAMS AND STRONGER CONNECTIONS FOR THOSE STUDENTS TO BUSINESS AND INDUSTRY OPPORTUNITIES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE UNIVERSITY SEES DEMAND FOR THIS PROGRAM FROM STUDENTS, FACULTY, EMPLOYERS AND COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS.  THE WHOLISTIC, MULTIDISCIPLINARY APPROACH TO THIS DEGREE PROGRAM IS EXPECTED TO POSITIVELY IMPACT ALL OF THOSE GROUPS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DEVELOP INTERDISCIPLINARY COURSE CURRICULA IN PLASTICS CIRCULARITY, WITH THREE DIFFERENT COURSES IN THE DIVISION OF ENERGY, MATTER AND SYSTEMS AT THE UNIVERSITY OF MISSOURI-KANSAS CITY IN KANSAS CITY, MI: A CRITICAL THINKING COURSE, A RESEARCH SKILL TRAINING COURSE, AND A POLYMER CHARACTERIZATION LAB COURSE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: A MULTIDISCIPLINARY TEAM OF FACULTY, WITH HELP FROM GRADUATE TEACHING ASSISTANTS WILL DEVELOP CURRICULA AND IMPLEMENT THE THREE COURSES OVER THREE YEARS WITHIN THE NEWLY RESTRUCTURED DIVISION IN THEIR NEW SCHOOL OF SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING.  THE PLAN INCLUDES TARGET ENROLLMENT NUMBERS AND PLANS TO TRACK OUTCOMES FOR STUDENTS WHO COMPLETE THE COURSES THROUGH COURSE EVALUATIONS AND TRACKING OF DEGREE AND CAREER CHOICES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PROPOSERS EXPECT SIGNIFICANT INTEREST IN ENROLLMENT IN THE COURSES, INCREASED PARTICIPATION IN THE PARTICIPATING STEM MAJORS.  THEY EXPECT TO USE SUCCESSFUL ENROLLMENT NUMBERS AND POSITIVE EVALUATIONS FROM BOTH STUDENTS AND INSTRUCTORS TO MOTIVATE FURTHER DEVELOPMENT OF SEVERAL COMPLEMENTARY COURSES ENABLING THEM TO OFFER ENOUGH CREDITS FOR A BACHELOR OF SCIENCE DEGREE IN PLASTICS CIRCULARITY.  THEY EXPECT THE DEGREE AND THE CORRESPONDING COURSES TO ALSO ASSIST IN FOSTERING STRONG COLLABORATION AMONG THE MULTIPLE FACULTY REPRESENTING DIFFERENT DISCIPLINES IN THEIR NEWLY FORMED SCHOOL AND DIVISION.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE IMMEDIATE BENEFICIARIES ARE THE STUDENTS AND FACULTY OF THE UNIVERSITY WHO PARTICIPATE IN THE PROGRAM.  OTHER BENEFICIARIES ARE EXPECTED TO BE THE BUSINESSES AND INDUSTRIES WHO HIRE GRADUATES.  THERE IS ALSO A PLAN TO DISSEMINATE THE WORK THROUGH PUBLIC WEBINARS, PROFESSIONAL MEETING PRESENTATIONS AND JOURNAL PUBLICATIONS AND ADDITIONAL PUBLIC EVENTS, FOR EXAMPLE, WORKING WITH THE LOCAL NPR AFFILIATE AND SHARING WITH TRADE ASSOCIATIONS, AND CREATION OF A PUBLIC WEBSITE.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO LOWER THE BARRIERS IMPEDING ACCESS TO HIGH QUALITY METROLOGY. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: A WORKSHOP/CONFERENCE BRINGING TOGETHER MANY OF THE LATEST DEVELOPMENTS IN "OPEN METROLOGY" WILL BE CONDUCTED, WITH AROUND 20 SPEAKERS DISCUSSING MANY OF THE ASPECTS OF THIS NOVEL FIELD. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS WORKSHOP WILL BEGIN LAYING THE GROUNDWORK FOR A VIBRANT COMMUNITY OF RESEARCHERS THAT ARE SEEKING OUT BEST PRACTICES IN OPEN METROLOGY AND DEVELOPING SITUATIONAL AWARENESS OF COMPETING IDEAS.  IT IS HOPED THIS WORKSHOP WILL LEAD TO FOLLOW-ON MEETINGS AND IDEAS IN HOW TO CREATE NEW METROLOGICAL TOOLS WITH ENHANCED ACCURACY AND LOWER COSTS THAN EXISTING APPROACHES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE GRANTEE WILL BENEFIT BY HOSTING A MARQUEE EVENT IN THE NASCENT AREA OF OPEN METROLOGY.  NIST AND THE PUBLIC WILL BENEFIT BY FURTHERING NIST'S MISSION TO PROVIDE THE PUBLIC WITH THE BEST, MOST ACCESSIBLE MEASUREMENT TECHNIQUES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT GLOBAL CITY TEAMS CHALLENGE (GCTC) PROGRAM STAKEHOLDERS TO INDEPENDENTLY DEVELOP AN INTEGRATED AND SUPPORTIVE SMART CITIES AND COMMUNITIES STRATEGY BASED ON A SERIES OF WORKSHOPS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: TWO-PART WORKSHOP SERIES WILL BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS GRANT. THE FIRST WORKSHOP WILL BE HOSTED BY GEORGE MASON UNIVERSITY, WHICH IS DESIGNED TO ESTABLISH A STRATEGIC RESEARCH VISION FOR GCTC SUPERCLUSTERS. THIS PART OF THE RESEARCH WILL FACILITATE THE UNDERSTANDING OF HOW THE GCTC ORGANIZATION INTERACTS WITH INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL PARTNERS TO ACHIEVE TECHNOLOGY IMPLEMENTATIONS AND DOCUMENT BEST PRACTICES. THE SECOND WORKSHOP WILL LEVERAGE THE RESULTS FROM THE FIRST WORKSHOP AND WILL FOCUS ON ORGANIZATIONAL AND STRATEGIC PLANNING FROM THE GCTC COMMUNITY PERSPECTIVE. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RESULTS OF THE WORKSHOP SERIES WILL BE USED TO CONSTRUCT A REPORT TO INFORM AND GUIDE THE STRATEGIC DIRECTION OF THE GCTC ORGANIZATION TO BENEFIT COMMUNITIES AND THE PUBLIC. MEANWHILE, THE WORKSHOP SERIES WILL PRODUCE INSIGHTS INTO THE COMPLEX AND INTERDEPENDENT CHALLENGES OF DISSEMINATING AND IMPLEMENTING TECHNOLOGY IN THE SMART AND CONNECTED INFRASTRUCTURE SYSTEMS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE RESEARCH CONDUCTED UNDER THIS PROPOSAL WILL SUPPORT REQUIREMENTS ANALYSES AND STRATEGIC PLANNING TO ENGAGE GCTC STAKEHOLDERS TO INFORM, STRENGTHEN AND EXPAND THE GCTC PROGRAM. IT WILL ALSO HELP GCTC TO DETERMINE FUTURE DIRECTIONS FOR ORGANIZATIONAL, COMMUNITY AND PUBLIC BENEFIT AND HELP IMPROVE PUBLIC SERVICES, SAFETY AND SECURITY IN COMMUNITIES OF ALL TYPES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.
